make it.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to succeed in getting somewhere in time for something or when this is difficult
make it.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: If we run, we should make it.
With blood pouring from his leg, he made it to a nearby house.
make it.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to be successful at something, for example in your job
make it.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: He came to the US and not only made it but made it big (=was extremely successful).
So far, relatively few women have made it to the top in the business world.
How did anyone so stupid make it to manager?
He was told he had no talent and would never make it as a professional singer.
England look less likely to make it to the finals.
make it.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to be able to go to an event, meeting etc that has been arranged
make it.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: I’m really sorry, but I won’t be able to make it on Sunday after all.
Nice to see you. I’m glad you could make it.
make it.translation[0].definitions[3].de: to continue to live after you have been seriously ill or badly injured
make it.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: Frank was very ill, and the doctors didn’t think he’d make it.
make it.translation[0].definitions[4].de: to manage to deal with a difficult experience
make it.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: I couldn’t have made it through those times without the support of my boyfriend.
make it.translation[0].definitions[5].de: used to say or ask what time it is according to your own or someone else’s watch
make it.translation[0].definitions[5].ex: What time do you make it?
I make it ten past three.
